author: Jodie Bradley
title: The Strood: High tide waters to make Essex road 'impassable' today - Essex Live
text:
News The Strood: High tide waters to make Essex road 'impassable' today Drivers are urged to stay wary of the tide waters essexlive Bookmark
Share
News By Jodie Bradley 07:49, 13 DEC 2024 Bookmark
The Strood in Mersea can regularly flood during high tide (Image: Stephen Huntley/HVC) Get the latest traffic and travel news straight to your inbox

Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice Due to a higher-than-normal tide, the Strood (B1025) is expected to be impassible this morning. High tide today (December 13) is expected at about 9.49am and is estimated to be just under five meters deep.
The road will be blocked between East Mersea Road to Mersea Road. While the road floods regularly, today is expected to be particularly deep, and drivers occasionally become stranded every time the road does have a deep flood.
The Strood is expected to be blocked going in both directions and is likely to be completely impassable. This is set to cause some delays on the road.
READ MORE: Police smash down door in raid as four arrested for drug offences across Essex
READ MORE: The busy town named the 'saddest' place to live in Essex by Rightmove
Local organisation StroodCam , who monitor the road, says: "Tide heights are affected by the weather and can suprise you. If you absolutely must get across, and the predicted tide height is 4.9m or above, allow about 1 hour either side of the high tide time."
